DataElement.preferredName: Patient Therapeutic Corticosteroid Specified Disease or Disorder Administered Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes no indicator related to whether the patient is receiving corticosteroids for specific indications

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Therapeutic Corticosteroid Specified Disease or Disorder Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to whether the patient is receiving corticosteroids for specific indications

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Therapeutic Corticosteroid Specified Disease or Disorder Administered
Property.preferredDefinition: Any steroid hormone made in the adrenal cortex (the outer part of the adrenal gland). They are also made in the laboratory. Corticosteroids have many different effects in the body, and are used to treat many different conditions. They may be used as hormone replacement, to suppress the immune system, and to treat some side effects of cancer and its treatment. Corticosteroids are also used to treat certain lymphomas and lymphoid leukemias.:Clearly and explicitly stated.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: Any steroid hormone made in the adrenal cortex (the outer part of the adrenal gland). They are also made in the laboratory. Corticosteroids have many different effects in the body, and are used to treat many different conditions. They may be used as hormone replacement, to suppress the immune system, and to treat some side effects of cancer and its treatment. Corticosteroids are also used to treat certain lymphomas and lymphoid leukemias.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.
